byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

abstract: Second day of testimony in trial of Baltimore Police Officer William G Porter for death of Freddie Gray reveals lingering scars Gray's death has left on both his friends and family, as well as on city; Porter's lawyers attempt to shift blame for Gray's death onto another officer and are framing case as indictment of city's police department as whole.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Officer William G. Porter faulted the driver of the van Mr. Gray was riding in when he injured his spine and depicted a badly run and poorly equipped police department.

headline.main: Officer’s Lawyers Try to Shift Blame in Freddie Gray’s Death
headline.print_headline: Officer’s Lawyers Try to Shift Blame in Freddie Gray’s Death

snippet: Lawyers for Officer William G. Porter faulted the driver of the van Mr. Gray was riding in when he injured his spine and depicted a badly run and poorly equipped police department.
